chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

fractran_zero_num_step : forall l, Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> forall x : nat, exists y : nat, l /F/ x → y
fractran_zero_num : forall l (x : nat), Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> exists y : nat, l /F/ x → y
fractran_rt_no_zero_num : forall l, Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> forall n x : nat, fractran_steps l n x 0 -> x = 0
fractran_step_no_zero_num : forall l, Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y = 0 -> x = 0
fractran_stop = fun l (x : nat) => forall z : nat, ~ l /F/ x → z : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_stop _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_steps = fun l => rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
fractran_compute = fun l (x y : nat) => exists n : nat, fractran_steps l n x y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_compute _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_terminates = fun l (x : nat) => exists y : nat, fractran_compute l x y /\ fractran_stop l y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_terminates _%list_scope _%nat_scope
FRACTRAN_REG_PROBLEM = {l : list (nat * nat) & {_ : nat | fractran_regular l}} : Set
FRACTRAN_HALTING_on_zero_first_no_zero_den : forall (p q : nat) l, q <> 0 -> FRACTRAN_HALTING ((p, q) :: l, 0) < -> False
fractran_step_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
fractran_step_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
Inductive fractran_step : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop := in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y | in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y Arguments fractran_step _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_0 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_1 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_step_inv : forall (P : list (nat * nat)) (x y : nat), P /F/ x → y -> exists l (p q : nat) (r : list (nat * nat)), P = l ++ (p, q) :: r /\ (forall u v : nat, In (u, v) l -> ~ divides v (u * x)) /\ q * y = p * x
Exists_or : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Exists P l \/ Exists Q l -> Exists (fun x : A => P x \/ Q x) l
Exists_or_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Exists (fun x : A => P x \/ Q x) l -> Exists P l \/ Exists Q l
fractran_step_bound : forall l, fractran_regular l -> {k : nat | forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y <= k * x}
Refl.make_impl_map : forall (A B : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (eval' : A * B -> Prop) (l : list (A * B)) (r : Prop), (forall x : A * B, eval' x <-> eval (fst x)) -> Refl.make_impl eval' l r < -> Refl.make_impl eval (map fst l) r

```coq
intros H.
destruct H as [c Hc].
destruct c as [a b].
unfold FRACTRAN_HALTING. split. 
- intros Hhalting. apply FRACTRAN_HALTING_zero_num in Hhalting. apply Hhalting.
- intros Hfalse. inversion Hfalse.
Qed.```
